text: Brett Dean (born 23 October 1961) is a contemporary Australian composer, violist and conductor. He was born in Brisbane, Queensland. In 1981 he was a prize winner in the ABC Symphony Australia Young Performers Awards. From 1985 to 1999, Dean was a violist in the Berlin Philharmonic Orchestra. Dean was Artistic Director of the Australian National Academy of Music in Melbourne until June 2010 when his brother, Paul, got the job."ANAM Announces New Artistic Director" at Australian Stage, 26 March 2010 On 5 March 2020, it was confirmed that Dean was hospitalized in Adelaide with the COVID-19 illness. ==References== ==Other websites== * Australian Music Centre * Biography, Boosey & Hawkes * Brett Dean's Homepage with his agency, Intermusica * Complete live performance of Brett Dean's violin concerto The Lost Art of Letter Writing by Australian violinist Sophie Rowell with Adelaide Symphony Orchestra conducted by Arvo Volmer Category:1961 births Category:Living people Category:Australian composers Category:Violinists Category:Australian conductors Category:Musicians from Brisbane
title: Brett Dean
